s: ^"Hey boss, I was hoping I could talk to you about my injury..."

c-0: ^"Of course Sam, come on in... What's on your mind?"

s: ^"I'm ready to come back boss, I want to play in the final."
^"Doc doesn't think I'm ready to be back yet... but I want you to put me in the squad for the final."

c-0: ^"That's not what I heard... Doc says you need a few more days, maybe a week before your fully fit."

s: ^"Doc hasn't worked with me on an injury before, he doesn't realise just how hard I work on my conditioning. I'm 100% confident I can deliver my usual high level of play."
^"That's not his call, I know my body better than anyone and I'm ready."

c-0: ^"I don't know what you're trying to prove here Sam, a concussion doesn't care how hard you train. I get that you want to be out there, anyone would, but you could end up hindering the team."

s: ^"I'm not trying to prove anything, my career speaks for itself and that team can't do this without me."
^"I don't want to hinder the team but they aren't the same without me on the field. They lose their heads when they don't have a leader to look to."

c-0: ^"I strongly disagree Sam... but it will be a hell of a lot harder to win without you. Are you sure about this?"

s: ^"No doubt in my mind. Let me loose Boss, and I'll bring you back a trophy."
^"100%. I need to play, and the team needs me to play as well."

c-0: ^"Fine, you can play... but you're hitting the bench at the first sign of any issues."

s: ^You're making the right decision Boss, I've got this.

c-0: ^You'd better Sam... I've got meetings to attend. We'll talk again soon.

c-1: ^"Then by all means, show the league what you've got left in the tank. Don't let me down."

s: ^"No chance of that happening Boss. You and the lads will get my very best."

c-0: ^"I hope so Sam. Head to the training pitch, lets put you through your paces just to be sure."

c-1: ^"You are a key part of the squad Sam, but no one is irreplaceable. You really want to go through with this?"

s: ^"100%. I need to play, and the team needs me to play as well."
^"No doubt in my mind. Let me loose Boss, and I'll bring you back a trophy."

c-0: ^"Then by all means, show the league what you've got left in the tank. Don't let me down."

s: ^"No chance of that happening Boss. You and the lads will get my very best."

c-0: ^"I hope so Sam. Head to the training pitch, lets put you through your paces just to be sure."

c-1: ^"Fine, you can play... but you're hitting the bench at the first sign of any issues."

s: ^You're making the right decision Boss, I've got this.

c-0: ^You'd better Sam... I've got meetings to attend. We'll talk again soon.

c-1: ^"That's exactly his call, whether you like it or not. His job is to protect our players, you included, so when he says you're not ready I have take that into consideration."

s: ^"I don't need protecting, I'm a Rugby player, and one of the best in the country. I can do this Boss."
^"I get that, but I don't need protecting. I need to be out there, helping this team win. We've come so far, I want to see this through."

c-0: ^I'm not doubting that Sam, but I need you to be sure that you're making the right decision."

s: ^"I'm sure Boss. The team need me and I intend to step up."
^"Of course Boss, I'm raring to go, just say the word."

c-0: ^"Then you're in, don't let me down Sam, we're going to need you out there."

s: ^"I won't Gaffer, you and the team will get the very best I can give."

c-0: ^"I look forward to it. Head to the training pitch, I'll see you down there."

c-1: ^"You've never given me a reason to doubt you Sam. You're in."

s: ^"And I never will. Thanks Gaffer, I appreciate your support."

c-0: ^"My pleasure, go down to the training pitch. The coaches will want to put you through your paces."

c-1: ^I'll always try and protect my players. But protecting them from themselves is often an impossible task. You're certain you're up for this?

s: ^"Of course Boss, I'm raring to go, just say the word."
^"I'm sure Boss. The team need me and I intend to step up."

c-0: ^"You've never given me a reason to doubt you Sam. You're in."

s: ^"And I never will. Thanks Gaffer, I appreciate your support."

c-0: ^"My pleasure, go down to the training pitch. The coaches will want to put you through your paces."

c-1: ^"Then you're in, don't let me down Sam, we're going to need you out there."

s: ^"I won't Gaffer, you and the team will get the very best I can give."

c-0: ^"I look forward to it. Head to the training pitch, I'll see you down there."

c-1: ^"Doc thinks you need more time and I'm inclined to agree... Concussions are not to be taken lightly Sam."

s: ^"I know, and I am taking it seriously, believe me... but I'm tough and I really think I can give you 100%."
^"I understand his concerns... but I got through training fine yesterday, ask the lads."

c-0: ^"It's not about how tough you are, it's a question of safety. Doc knows what he's talking about and he wouldn't be recommending you sit out the Final without a real concern for your health."

s: ^"I don't mean to question the Doc, but I know myself and I can play! I want to be out there for with the lads.
^"If I'm willing to take the risk then that should be all that matters. I've had a long career and played through far worse injuries whilst still being one of the best players on the pitch."

c-0: ^"I know the team appreciate your passion, and your desire to play Sam. Look if you're certain, I will consider starting you, but you have to be sure."

s: ^"I'm sure. Winning this final is the only thing on my mind... I can't wait to get out there."
^"I am, Boss. I can do this. I've had a long career and I feel like it's all lead to this moment."

c-0: ^"Me either Sam, I just hope you can manage the whole 80 minutes."

s: ^"I can do it. I have to do it, for myself and for the team."

c-0: ^"Then report to the training pitch, lets make sure your at peak fitness in time for the final."

c-1: ^"Fine words Sam, and I know you mean them. If you're confident then I'll back you, Are you ready?"

s: ^"I'm ready."

c-0: ^"Then report to training, we want you at peak performance against Birmingham."

c-1: ^"You may have played through other severe injuries Sam, but concussions are another level, they can have real long-term repercussions. Are you willing to risk that?"

s: ^"I am, Boss. I can do this. I've had a long career and I feel like it's all lead to this moment."
^"I'm sure. Winning this final is the only thing on my mind... I can't wait to get out there."

s: ^"I'm ready."

s: ^"I can do it. I have to do it, for myself and for the team."

c-0: ^"Then report to the training pitch, lets make sure your at peak fitness in time for the final."

c-1: ^"The lads don't have advanced medical degrees Sam. At the end of the day, I don't know if I'm comfortable putting you out there when you're less than 100%."

s: ^"What Rugby player ever feels 100%? I've been playing with injuries since I was 23, this is no different!"
^"I get it Boss, but a minor concussion won't stop me from giving the team my best."

c-0: ^"Concussions aren't like other injuries though Sam. Are you truly confident that you can be the player we've come to rely on for the final?"

s: ^"I'm telling you, I can play through it. The moment you think you see my performance drop, you can take me off."
^"I wouldn't risk it if I wasn't sure, there's no way I could do that to the team. I can do this for them, I'm sure of it."

c-0: ^"Ok Sam, you're starting... but the first sign of trouble I'm bringing you off."

s: ^"Of course Gaffer, I swear you'll only get my best. If I'm giving any less than that, I'll take myself off."

c-0: ^"I know you will. Report to the training pitch, and make sure you see the Doc again to pass the protocols."

c-1: ^"Alright Sam, I know the team will feel better having you out there. Just remember, any sign of symptoms and I want you to flag us down."

s: ^"Absolutely, the last thing I want to do is hold back the team. Thanks for backing me Boss."

c-0: ^"You've earned that much from me AND the team Sam. Don't let us down."

c-1: ^"I trust you Sam, but I need you to be sure about this. I can't have you holding us back if the concussion starts to affect you."
